intro: Maytenus arboreus, commonly known as the white mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. Maytenus arboreus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types and exhibiting moderate drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
